events.name: Developer's Gym with ThoughtWorks
events.description: Time: 30 June, Saturday afternoon 2-5pm. Venue:ThoughtWorks office11-08 China Square Central18 Cross StreetSingapore[masked] Note: you need to bring your IC card and register your name at the security desk on level 1 before you can get access. *** So we are limiting this to 20 participants for the first run. RSVP only if you are sure you can make it. Otherwise, please release your slot for others. Many thanks! *** What you will learn:* Why is Test Driven Development (TDD) helpful?* Some rules to follow when you do development with TDD approach* Hands-on experience by applying TDD in problem-solving Who should attend:* You are already familiar with one programming language.* You are familiar with one unit testing library in that language.* You know how to start a new project with your favorite IDE/editor.* You heard about TDD but haven’t used it much before (or you would like to do more hands-on exercise to polish your skills) What you need to bring with you:* your IC card (to register at the security desk)* your laptop with your development environment setup Agenda:* Talk: Introduction to Test Driven Development (TDD)* Hands-on exercises (you can do the exercises with the programming language you are most familiar with). As an introduction to TDD, the facilitators will roughly follow the content in the first 10 chapters in this free online book, although they would customize the content by combining their experiences for TDD. You can download the PDF file here: http://www.codemanship.co.uk/tdd_jasongorman_codemanship.pdf
events.location: ThoughtWorks , 18 cross street #11-08 China Sq Central (S)048423, Singapore

events.name: BlockFellows Singapore Hub Advanced Blockchain Programming Session 2
events.description: Advanced Blockchain Programming Session 2 – Ethereum Development Deep Dive(30th June 2PM – 5PM)We will do a deep dive into Ethereum, as well as Solidity in this session. (and Truffle if we have time) Please bring along your laptop, chargers and water bottle (if needed).
events.location: BASH @ Blk79, #03-01, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, Singapore 139955

events.name: Soccast E-world cup 2018
events.description:
Get together, play EA Sports™ FIFA 18 on PS4, and watch 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia with fellow residents. We are bringing ESports islandwide to the heartlands. Join a qualifier at any participating Community Centre to compete for the top 3 spots and represent your community at the Grand Final of Soccast E-World Cup 2018!
Players are encouraged to stay on after the tournament to watch the scheduled FIFA World Cup match live!
 
Tournament
 
Qualifier：
1、 Kampong Glam CC will be held on Tuesday, 26th June, at Kampong Glam CC at 1900 - 2130. 
2、Heartbeat @ Bedok qualifier will be held on  Saturday, 30th June at Heartbeat @ Bedok at 1900 - 2130. 
3、Keat Hong CC qualifier will be held on Wednesday, 27th June at Keat Hong CC, at 1900 - 2130
4、Punggol 21 qualifier will be held on Friday, 6th July, at Punggol 21 CC at 1900 - 2130.
5、Yew Tee CC qualifier will be held on Saturday, 7th July, at Yew Tee CC at 1900 - 2130
The competition format is single elimination.
The qualifiers are limited to the first 32 registrants. So hurry and sign up now!
Please read the rules below. For any clarification email event@orientivity.com.
 
Prizes
 
Champion: Football
1st Runner-up: World Cup Fan T-shirt
2nd Runner-up: Football Merchandise
 
Final：
Punggol 21 be held on Sunday, 15th July, at Punggol 21 CC at 1900 - 2130

Fifa 18 Rules
 
1. The ORGANIZER of the Soccast E-World Cup (SEWC) will be Orientivity Pte Ltd.
2. The ORGANIZER reserves the right to amend any of these rules as deemed necessary for the fair and proper conduct of the SEWC.
3. Completion of the Player Registration form confirms the Participants’ agreement to abide by all Rules and Regulations set by the organizer. All Rules and Regulations are subjected to the interpretation of the organizer and all decisions made will be final unless stated otherwise.
4. All games played for the FIFA tournament are played on FIFA 18 for the PS4 console.
5. Players are advised to bring their own controllers. Controllers will also be provided on the event day. Players who are bringing their own controllers are reminded to log out of the console after their matches
6. 3rd Party controllers are prohibited. Only the use of PS4 controllers are allowed.
7. No coaching is allowed (for example, people in the audience may not advise a Player while playing).
8. No memory cards or saved games are permitted.
9. If a controller is defective, a Player can pause the game and notify the referee. The referee will determine the controller status in making such a decision. If a Player plays with a defective controller, all results are nevertheless valid.
10. Unnecessary pauses or delays are prohibited.
11. Any action designed to disrupt the opposing Player’s view of the field or ability to select controlled players is prohibited.
12. Each game will begin play at its designated time, and as designated on-site at the tournament.
13. Players who are late will be given a maximum wait time of 10 minutes before they will be disqualified
14. Players will be shown their designated station, shall set up the game and immediately begin play. Each Player will have 2 minutes to configure controls, line-ups, and settings.
15. Players shall be responsible for keeping track of game situation so if a game is interrupted, the situation can be restored. In all situations possible, tournament referees will monitor the game situation so that it may be restored in the event of game interruptions.
16. Players shall raise their hands at the end of the game, so a referee can record their score. Only scores reported to the referee are official.
17. No game interruptions, except for designated pauses to report scores (if any), will be allowed.
18. Players are not allowed to warm-up or use the consoles at any point in time if they do not have a game to play.
19. Should there be any disputes, players are to pause the game when the ball is out of play and inform the admin on site immediately.
20. No refunds will be given should there be any walkovers or disqualifications.
21. If a game is interrupted intentionally by any Player, that Player will immediately be disqualified.
22. If a game interruption is caused by outside circumstances such as a machine error or loss of power, the game shall be continued from the point of interruption.
 
Format
 
Players can only pick from FIFA World Cup squads. No league clubs are to be used.
This will be a single elimination tournament with participants playing one game.
In the event of a tie:
1. The game will go into classic extra time.
2. In the event of a tie after classic extra time, games will be settled with a penalty shootout.
 
Miscellaneous important rules
 
Time-wasting is strictly forbidden. Example of time wasting will be passing the ball among your defenders in your own half only during the last few minutes.
Custom formations are not permitted. Custom tactics are allowed.
A pause can only be made in the following scenarios:
1. When the ball is out of play (Throw-in/Free Kicks/Corners/Kick-off)
2. Half Time
3. When a player is injured and unable to carry on with the game
4. Controller issues
Any players caught pausing while the game is in play, will be given a warning
events.location: Kampong Glam CC, Heartbeat @ Bedok, Keat Hong CC, Punggol 21 null
